item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Monday, September 30, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. On leaving my last job (leaving Apple) (27 points | 6 comments)
2. Building a robust frontend using progressive enhancement (65 points | 10 comments)
3. Don’t believe the hype: AGI is far from inevitable (26 points | 12 comments)
4. Prep: Golang comptime. Pure blasphemy (18 points | 6 comments)
5. The Public Domain Problem (22 points | 13 comments)
6. Notes on the Crystal language (47 points | 17 comments)
7. Use of Prolog for developing a new programming language (1992) (7 points | 1 comment)
8. Build a serverless ACID database with this one neat trick (atomic PutIfAbsent) (7 points | no comments)
9. Using undocumented Apple AI/ML instructions to get the average color of an image (3 points | no comments)
10. We Have a Package for You! A Comprehensive Analysis of Package Hallucinations by Code Generating LLMs (3 points | no comments)
11. Type-erased generic functions for C: A modest non-proposal (6 points | no comments)
12. Brackets are awesome, don’t use them (15 points | 19 comments)
13. Varlink Now (2 points | 4 comments)
14. Sitina1 Open-source Camera (33 points | 1 comment)
15. bpfsnake: snake in bpftrace (6 points | no comments)
16. go-sqlite3: Go bindings to SQLite using wazero (1 points | no comments)
17. Renderling Devlog, Implementing Frustum Culling using Rust-GPU (1 points | no comments)
18. What brings an upgrade to GCC 14 from GCC 13? (3 points | 1 comment)
19. Any interesting tech blogs outside the usual software/web dev circle? (2 points | no comments)
20. All Systems Go! 2024 (11 points | no comments)
21. Arch Linux and Valve Collaboration (129 points | 28 comments)
22. Some Go web dev notes (66 points | 27 comments)
23. Overbooking - how providers divide up the bandwidth (3 points | 3 comments)
24. The perils of transition to 64-bit time_t (27 points | 9 comments)
25. Everything you need to know about Python 3.13 – JIT and GIL went up the hill (21 points | 11 comments)
